body:
and what does 

```
git remote add origin https://github.com/pleabargain/test.git
git push -u origin master
```

give you in a shell?
it's probably a prompt for input, and thus a duplicate of known issues.
That was what I was thinking about. Hence the question.

re: prompt for input
There is a git prompt now in the terminal (I don't know for sure if it was there last time I tried... I don't think so but I'm not sure.)

I pulled latest git and when I ran:

```
%%bash
#you can get this part from github page after creating the repo
git remote add origin https://github.com/xyz.git
git push -u origin master
```

the terminal had a prompt for git UID and psswd. (that wasn't there before, I think)

I put them both in and then in the terminal I see:

```
Username for 'https://github.com': dennisgdaniels@gmail.com
Password for 'https://dennisgdaniels@gmail.com@github.com': 
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1): Unexpected error while autosaving notebook: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/dennis/Dropbox/python/courseraLearntoProgramTheFundamentals/Git Version Control for Python3 (1).ipynb'
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1) 4.67ms
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1): Unexpected error while autosaving notebook: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/dennis/Dropbox/python/courseraLearntoProgramTheFundamentals/Git Version Control for Python3 (1).ipynb'
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1) 4.53ms

```

in the notebook I see kernel busy

I opened another terminal and found that the git command had worked

```
git remote add origin https://github.com/xyz.git
git push -u origin master
```

git remote -v

returned the fetch and the push

but the kernel is still busy

```
Username for 'https://github.com': dennisgdaniels@gmail.com
Password for 'https://dennisgdaniels@gmail.com@github.com': 
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1): Unexpected error while autosaving notebook: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/dennis/Dropbox/python/courseraLearntoProgramTheFundamentals/Git Version Control for Python3 (1).ipynb'
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1) 5.92ms
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1): Unexpected error while autosaving notebook: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/dennis/Dropbox/python/courseraLearntoProgramTheFundamentals/Git Version Control for Python3 (1).ipynb'
WARNING:root:400 PUT /notebooks/b5758c2d-84a5-42d1-9e82-223889eddb62 (127.0.0.1) 6.30ms

```

The last warning is after I tried to save the ipynb file.

I shut down the kernel in the notebook. Shutdown the notebook in the dashboard as well and then restarted the noteobook.

I ran 

```
%%bash

git remote -v
```

and Ipython3 came back with git's response...

So, the fix is somewhere in the shutdown and restart?

with sincere regards and thanks for your patience,
Dennis
Since this is subprocesses prompting for input, I'm closing as a duplicate of #514
